intro: Pityrodia verbascina, commonly known as the woolly sunhemp, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant is an annual or biennial herb that thrives in dry, sandy soils. Its fibrous stems and leaves are often used in traditional medicine and as a source of fiber. Pityrodia verbascina is also valued for its ability to fix nitrogen and improve soil fertility.
